places.name: Beylerbeyi Palace

reviews.text:
Tucked away in the heart of Üsküdar, the Beylerbey Museum is a hidden gem that brings the world of Sultan Abdul Hamid to life in the most elegant, mesmerizing way. It's not a huge museum - but wow, every inch is packed with beauty, detail, and history.

The rooms are like scenes from a lost era. Breathtaking furniture, man-made masterpieces in the form of chairs, tables, curtains, even the carpets - every element speaks luxury and craftsmanship. The walls and ceilings are adorned with delicate drawings, and the lighting, the fabrics, the placement of each item… it all feels intentional and poetic.

Each room is labeled, with little sentences or quotes that give it a personal touch, as if the museum is whispering stories to you. And although there are guards everywhere, they're polite and don't hover too much. Photography is technically forbidden - but let's be honest, most of us still managed to sneak a few shots. Too pretty not to!

Because it's not a massive space, you don't feel exhausted - the visit is smooth and fast-paced, especially since it gets a bit crowded with school tours. But it's clean, organized, and never boring. After the museum, you can stroll through the peaceful garden outside, with trees and a fountain that just beg you to sit and breathe it all in.

One downside? The prices around the museum are no joke. I paid 200 lira for one cookie - felt more like robbery than dessert. If you're on a budget, better walk a bit farther out to grab food or snacks.

Still, the experience was magical. I'd go again in a heartbeat, and I definitely recommend it - especially with its spot right by the coast. Watching the ships and boats glide across the water just adds to the charm. History, beauty, and a sea breeze? Yes, please.

I am not the biggest fan of places where the entrance fee is high (for what you can explore) - 15€ for a rather small palace, and additionally you are NOT ALLOWED to take some time and make nice pictures. Also, there is construction going on and practically the whole facade is covered. The palace is nice inside but it's a long way from the center and no pictures officialy allowed, wouldn't come again.

Cheap entry for the garden- 60TL. Lovely garden, have a toilet and photo opportunities are great. Didn't bother going inside as don't think it is worth it, some of the places is under construction so I don't know if you can visit it all. But gardens very nice and the view of the sea is nice too! Waited 10 minutes in the queue to get inside at 4pm on a Wednesday in July.

places.generalDescription: Rumeli Fortress, a 15th-century hilltop stronghold with numerous towers and scenic walking paths offering stunning views of the water, is a significant historical site in Istanbul. Situated on the European side of the Bosporus, it was constructed to safeguard the strait before the conquest. The fortress covers 30 acres and features towers named after supervisors during its construction.

sources.snippet: You’ll set sail along the coastline of both the European and Asian sides of Istanbul, taking in the sights from the palaces of Dolmabahce, Beylerbeyi, and Ciragan to the fortress of Rumeli Fortress and Anadolu. Sip on complimentary coffee or tea or splurge on a cocktail or glass of sparkling wine while taking in Istanbul’s gorgeousness from your private yacht. Check out availability and pricing of private cruises.
sources.shortName: How To Plan an Epic Honeymoon in Istanbul in 5 Easy Steps

sources.snippet: Istanbul is one of the most historically and culturally rich cities in the world. There are countless places to visit and explore in this magnificent city, but one of the most striking locations along the Bosphorus is Rumeli Fortress, a must-see historical site. With its unique architecture and historical significance, Rumeli Fortress is an ideal destination for a romantic stroll with your partner.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places in Istanbul - Zehra Grup

places.name: Rumeli Fortress

reviews.text: Beautiful site. Was being restored when we visited so could only walk around the garden. But for 6 Euros it was a great place to be in a bit of nature and escape the busy city.

At about 6 euro entry, but also included with the muze card, it's a realistic price for a site like this.
However, the whole fortress is being restored, so you can not access any part of the walls , towers, and Ramparts.
So, while the conservation works are ongoing, I wouldn't bother coming here.
When open fully, I would definitely return. As of now, you'll spend more time getting there from the city centre than actually being there

Awesome views. If you're a local or student, very cheap, only 50 lira for students as of August 2025. Beautiful, breathtaking views. Can't walk on the walls for now because of renovations but most of the castle is visitable. There's also Ottoman and Byzantine artifacts on display in the fortress grounds.

Very underrated spot also, not many tourists here, mainly locals. Worth coming by via ferry.

places.address: Rumeli Hisarı, Yahya Kemal Cd. No: 42, 34470 Sarıyer/İstanbul, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: Büyükada, the largest of the Princes Islands in Turkey, is a charming destination offering stunning panoramic views, picturesque walking trails, and a variety of historic residences. Despite being just two square miles in size with a population of 7,000, Büyükada has been attracting travelers for over a thousand years with its lush hillsides and romantic coves.

sources.snippet: Büyükada, one of the most romantic islands of Istanbul, is a perfect escape for couples looking for peace and tranquillity from the noise of the city. Firstly, you can explore the beautiful roads of the island by renting a bicycle in the calm atmosphere of the island and you may not realise how the time passes in this peaceful silence. Especially at sunset, enjoy this moment with a cup of tea.
sources.siteName: Small and Boutique Hotels in Turkiye & Greece
sources.shortName: İstanbul's most romantic places

sources.snippet: For those seeking a peaceful retreat away from Istanbul’s bustle, Büyükada is a prime choice. This island is enchanted with its historical ambiance, charming wooden mansions, and stunning sea views, setting the stage for romantic moments. Renting bicycles to explore the island offers a closer look at its unique charm, making for an unforgettable experience.
sources.shortName: 20 Most Romantic Places In Istanbul

places.name: Büyükada

reviews.text: Very calm and quiet place. But you need to walk or take a bike to see that. Take a bus to the last station. Then you will walk at the end of the island and you will see. Many people didn't go there more far and it's the reason they said there's not much to do. You should explore. There is nature, birds, flowers, sea, horses, cows, cats and dogs. But you must do some effort not only to complain. Best to take a boat in the morning then you'll have more time. Only sad thing is, there is lots of trash and graffiti on the stones. It's so shameful. But because of people.. yes there's almost no bins for trash, but that's not excuse. I hope more people will appreciate it.

Not much to do. Restaurants and cafes at the port. Lots of empty vacation homes. Can get around using an electric bus, but at close to 100 lira per trip, the fare seems steep to me. Best thing about the island for me is the cats.

Not much to do here, you can hike up a hill. When it comes to souvenirs I recommend you buy them directly in the city, here they are like 2-3 times more expensive and also pretty old, the metals on them are starting to rust even.

places.generalDescription: Belgrade Forest in Istanbul offers a variety of outdoor activities for visitors to enjoy with their loved ones, such as hiking, jogging, and cycling. The lush green spaces and fresh air provide a serene setting for leisurely walks and picnics. The forest is home to several picturesque water lakes inhabited by various bird species, offering the opportunity to rent small boats for scenic tours. Additionally, there are charming cafes and restaurants nestled within the natural surroundings where visitors can savor a diverse selection of meals.

sources.snippet: Belgrade Forest is a nature paradise hidden in the heart of Istanbul and is a perfect option for a quiet getaway with your loved one. This vast forest is full of lush green trees, fresh air, and walking routes. Here you can take a romantic walk in the lap of nature, organize picnics, or explore by bike.
sources.shortName: 20 Most Romantic Places In Istanbul

places.name: Belgrade Forest

reviews.text: Hours of beauty in stunning nature and history. Hike trails map available on All Trails app if you'd like. The loop around a lake is lovely. Dog lovers will enjoy. The dogs were all so kind and loved to walk with us and be pet, all well behaved and happy. Early Nov, 2024.

One of the best places I've ever been to. I visited Belgrade Forest during the rain, and it made the experience even more unforgettable. The sound of water, the fresh smell of the forest, and the peaceful trails created a magical atmosphere. Everything was so green and alive, with wooden bridges, small waterfalls, and running streams all around. It's a perfect escape into nature, whether you're walking, taking photos, or just sitting and enjoying the silence. Highly recommend visiting, especially if you love nature in its raw, beautiful form.

Belgrad Forest is a perfect place to escape the city and connect with nature. The walking trails and peaceful atmosphere make it very relaxing. Ideal for anyone looking for fresh air and beautiful scenery.

places.generalDescription: Aya Yorgi Church, also known as the Church of St. George, is a reconstructed Greek Orthodox cathedral located on Buyukada, the largest of the Princes Islands. The church boasts a modest exterior and a lavish interior with exceptional Greek-style icons, including the famous icon of Saint George. While reaching the church involves a challenging trek up a steep hill, visitors are rewarded with breathtaking views from the top.

sources.snippet: Located at the very top point of Büyükada, this is a great place for nature and history enthusiast couples. Every year, people hike up to the Aya Yorgi church, unraveling a spool of string along the way to make a wish, and in this case you can tell your loved one that your wish has come true while you gaze out over a great sea view.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places For The Perfect Proposal In Istanbul

sources.snippet: Aya Yorgi Church, considered one of the best Istanbul churches, is on Buyukad Island. A church that dates back to the 18th century and is regarded as one of the unique sights of Istanbul. During your trip, I suggest you visit this church if you want to get married in a particular place.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Romantic Places In Istanbul For Couples(Update 2024)

places.name: Greek Orthodox Monastery of St George Koudounas

reviews.text:
I'm in good shape and healthy, but it still took me about 20 minutes of walking uphill, with a couple of stops along the way to catch my breath. If you're not in great shape or need mobility assistance, this climb could be really tough. That being said, the hike is absolutely worth it! The view from the top is stunning, and the cute little church is a must-see. Plus, it's free, which makes it even better. Highly recommended when you're on the island!

P.S. The church closes at 16:00, so make sure to get there before it closes. Also, if you're taking the island buses, keep in mind that each way costs about 65TL. On the way back to the island center, there aren't any ticket machines to recharge your transport card, so make sure you've got enough money on it for both directions. And don't forget to bring water, sunscreen, and a hat for the road!

The Aya Yorgi Church is located on Büyükada Island in Istanbul, Turkey. It is a notable landmark that offers  a glimpse into the region's history and culture

The church provides a serene atmosphere, making it a place for reflection and appreciation of historical significance. Visitors can learn about its history. Understand the church's role in the local community and its cultural significance.

The church's architecture reflects its rich history, with elements that showcase its importance in the region. Although specific details about its design might be limited, its presence on the island adds to the area's cultural heritage.
Tips
Respect the site: Be mindful of any rules or restrictions when visiting.
Take photos: Although a photo graph is not allowed at some parts, you can capture the church's architecture and the surrounding scenery.

The church is on a summit in the big island “buyukadad” , which is a bit hard to reach specially in summer weather as the road goes uphill and there's no way other than walking. But it also provides you so many beautiful scenes and when you go up high enough you can see parts of Istanbul across the sea which is breathtaking.
Inside the church is so quiet, relaxing and charming. The building is not that big.
In the end it is worth experiencing this whole combination of nature, history and religion.

sources.snippet: When in the city of inns, why not enjoy the Istanbul Bosphorus Cruise Tour?. Select a private yacht that offers a four-hour dinner cruise while granting you ample opportunities to admire the brightened mosques and bridges. Besides that, one of the most enjoyable things to do in Istanbul on the yacht is devouring a three-course dinner, accompanied by several drinks, while enjoying a twirling dervish show and glittering entertainment from belly dancers and local artists.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Istanbul at Night: 2025 Updated

sources.snippet: Cruising the Bosphorus at night is one of the most memorable experiences in Istanbul. Bosphorus, the pearl of Istanbul, will amaze you while you are enjoying the great sea ambiance!. The city's bright lights, iconic Maiden's Tower, and of course the Bosphorus Bridge will create a magical experience for you!
sources.shortName: Istanbul for Couples: What to Do in Istanbul as a Couple

places.name: Private Bosphorus Dinner Cruise Istanbul

reviews.text: One of the best nights we had in Istanbul! The dinner cruise was well-organized, and the seating was very comfortable with great views. The traditional folk dances were vibrant and entertaining, and the performers were so talented. After the cultural show, the DJ played upbeat music, and everyone had such a great time dancing. The combination of delicious dinner, great entertainment, and stunning Bosphorus views made it a perfect evening.

Marhaba 👋

I am writing to provide feedback on the boat tour that my family and I recently took in Istanbul. We booked the trip without dinner, and the tour cost us 150 TL per adult, with our 4-year-old child joining us free of charge.

Overall, we had a nice experience exploring Istanbul from the sea, both on the European and Asian sides. The view of Istanbul was amazing during the trip, and we appreciated the opportunity to see the city from a different perspective. However, we did notice that the boats were not well equipped with all the necessary safety measures for young children. As a result, I have rated the tour a 4 out of 5.

I wanted to bring this to your attention as I believe it's important to ensure the safety of all passengers on board. Perhaps in the future, you could consider providing additional safety equipment or implementing stricter safety guidelines to ensure that all passengers, including young children, are safe during the tour.

The Bosphorus Cruise is one of the best experiences in Istanbul and a must-do for any visitor. Sailing between Europe and Asia while enjoying breathtaking views of palaces, mosques, bridges, and waterfront mansions is simply magical. The fresh breeze and stunning city skyline make the journey relaxing and memorable. Evening cruises are especially beautiful with the illuminated Bosphorus Bridge and city lights. It's a perfect way to experience Istanbul's charm from the water. Highly recommended for couples, families, or even solo travelers!

places.address: Ömer Avni, Meclis-i Mebusan Cd. No:34-B Arkası, 34427 Beyoğlu/İstanbul, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: Belgrad Forest, located just north of Istanbul, is a sprawling 13,590-acre green space offering a variety of outdoor activities. Visitors can enjoy walking, running, hiking, and mountain biking around the nine nature parks within the forest. The Ataturk Arboretum showcases an impressive biodiversity with over 2000 tree and plant species in lakeside and sylvan settings. Picnic areas are available for visitors to relax and dine at cafe-restaurants within the forest.

sources.snippet: For those looking to escape the noise and crowds of Istanbul and spend time in nature, Belgrad Forest is one of the best options. Located within the city, this natural retreat is an excellent spot for a romantic outing with your partner. Ranking high on the list of romantic places to visit in Istanbul, Belgrad Forest not only offers a breathtaking natural landscape but also provides numerous outdoor activities.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places in Istanbul - Zehra Grup

sources.snippet: If you are a lover of nature, Belgrad Forest is among the best places you can go in Istanbul for a day or for a weekend trip.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places in Istanbul for Couples

places.name: Belgrad Forest Hiking

reviews.text: Great retreat, family friendly, many wooden chairs and tables for picnic. Natural environment, fresh air. A 5 stars experience.
A great place to walk and have a barbecue. It's very big. Turkish people are super friendly to foreigners unlike the ones in downtown. A great place to have fresh air and nice views in general.

What an amazing place...
You can spend so many hours.
You will not even realize how time has passed.

Bring your left over food as their are alot of animals you can feed. There is parking. The entrance is like 20 Turkish Lira...

The walking area is amazing. You can run, ride your bike and just chill. You can bring your own food and beverage. Use the restrooms before starting your walk as restrooms are only at the entrance. ✌🏻

places.generalDescription: Viktor Levi Şarap Evi is a charming wine bar located on the Asian side of Istanbul, offering a cozy and elegant dining experience. Situated in a historic property dating back to the 19th century, this venerable 100-year-old wine bar stands out with its leafy patio garden area and its own selection of red, white, and rose wines. The venue provides an opportunity to explore Turkish wines in a delightful setting.

sources.snippet: Did you know that Turkey is one of the oldest wine-producing countries in the world?. While you’re in Istanbul you’ll want to take advantage of your proximity to delicious old-world wine and Viktor Levi Şarap Evi on the Asian side is a great spot for getting to know Turkish wine. The stunning dining space is also worth checking out—be sure to book a table on the back patio for a cozy but elegant experience.
sources.shortName: 5 Romantic Date Spots In Istanbul To Visit This Spring

sources.snippet: Anyone fancying a glass of good and organic wine while breathing fresh air on a garden?. Well, you might as well check this one out. Located in a widely celebrated neighborhood in  Kadıköy (on the Anatolian side),  Tarihi Viktor Levi Sarap Evi is the perfect budget-friendly and peaceful date night option.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Romantic Restaurants in Istanbul in 2024 – Turkey Things

sources.siteName: #1 Loved Istanbul Food Tours - Yummy Istanbul
sources.shortName: Honeymoon in Istanbul: 6 Most Romantic Things to Do & More
Discovering the Most Romantic Places in Istanbul: A Couple's Guide

places.name: Viktor Levi Şarap Evi

reviews.text: We were looking for a place to dine and thank you to those who left reviews, we found this amazing place! In addition to the lovely staff, the food was amazing. If you are not familiar with the menu, staff will help you with details. The portions are big! The selection of wine and drinks is very complete, for all tastes. The restaurant is busy and that reflects in the overall ambiance. The dining experience was really good, we really enjoyed it.

A wonderful dining experience in a beautiful place, with amazing juicy steaks accompanied by lovely sauce and delicious starters, I particularly enjoyed the mashed fava. The red wine was also excellent and the service was good.
Great date spot! My husband takes me here and we have a great time every time. Feels more European than Turkish. Perfect place to enjoy wine and snacks.

places.address: Caferağa Mh Moda Cd. &, Damacı Sk. No:4, 34710 Kadıköy, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: Pierre Loti is a famous cafe located in Istanbul, offering stunning views of the Golden Horn. Situated in a historically and culturally rich area, it shares its name with the French novelist who once resided there. The cafe overlooks the Eyup Sultan Mosque and offers a contrasting environment to the pilgrimage site at the bottom of the hill. Pierre Loti, also known as Julien Viaud, was drawn to this spot due to his fascination with the East.

sources.snippet: If you’re a down-to-earth kind of couple, then Pierre Loti Café is definitely a great place to mark the beginning of your lives together. A simple café with a spectacular city view, the Pierre Loti looks over the Golden Horn and all its historic neighborhoods. Celebrate “yes” with some Turkish tea and gaze at the city (as well as into each other’s eyes).
sources.shortName: Romantic Places For The Perfect Proposal In Istanbul

sources.snippet: Located in Eyup Sultan district on the top of a hill that looks over the  Golden Horn. During the night  Pierre loti cafe turns out to be an extremely lovely place to spend time at, especially with the lights of Golden Horn adding a romantic touch. You can reach it using chair lifts but make sure to go there during the weekdays because it is full of people on holidays.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places in Istanbul - Love's Haven in the City

sources.snippet: Piere Loti cafe and restaurant over a hilltop, provides perfect setting for a romantic evening. Hold hands with your partner in the garden over the cliff and enjoy cool breeze overlooking all of Istanbul and the Golden Horn. You can spend countless time mesmerizing the ambiance of the place and when you do come back, I am sure you will cherish those times forever.
sources.shortName: five must visit romantic places of Istanbul

sources.snippet: Another famous hill of the City of Seven Hills (Istanbul is also known as city of seven hills, as the old city was built on seven hills on the Historical Peninsula), this one takes its name from the French author Pierre Loti, who lived in İstanbul between 1850 – 1923, and fell in love with it – for that we cannot really blame him…
sources.shortName: Romantic Places in Istanbul for Couples

sources.snippet: One of the first places that comes to mind when thinking of scenic spots in Istanbul is Pierre Loti Hill. Located in Eyüp, this hill is a must-visit destination for those who want to admire Istanbul’s breathtaking views. Overlooking the Golden Horn, Pierre Loti Hill is famous for its serene atmosphere and historical charm.
sources.shortName: Romantic Places in Istanbul - Zehra Grup

sources.snippet: Pierre Lotiis a cafe located at a high altitude, and when you go there, you can see the whole of Istanbul. It is a unique cafe in a pleasant atmosphere where you can change your mood and propose your marriage while drinking the best Turkish coffee. Address: Eyüp Merkez, Karyağdı Sk.
sources.shortName: 11 Best Romantic Places In Istanbul For Couples(Update 2024)

sources.snippet: On your way up the hill, you can visit the historical Eyüp district and then reach the top by cable car. At sunset, the sun shining on the Golden Horn creates a romantic atmosphere. You can enjoy this moment by having a coffee at Pierre Loti Kahvesi.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Places to Watch the Sunset in Istanbul

sources.snippet: Pierre Loti Hill is a dream spot for anyone who loves romance and scenic views in Istanbul. From this enchanting hilltop, you get a panoramic view of Istanbul’s unique beauty. You can either take a cable car to the top or walk, enjoying the journey.
sources.shortName: 20 Most Romantic Places In Istanbul

sources.snippet: Julien Viaud, a French writer, is honored with the hill's name. After moving to Istanbul, the author began writing his novels in a coffee shop. He later changed his name, and this hill carries his name.
sources.shortName: Istanbul for Couples: What to Do in Istanbul as a Couple

sources.snippet: Pierre Loti Hill: located at the far end of the Golden Horn, this hill offers luxury sunsets. It is named after the famous writer Pierre Loti, who used to sit here to watch the sunset often.
sources.shortName: Istanbul for couples - enjoy the most romantic places

places.name: Pierre Loti

reviews.text: My experience at the restaurant was overall great! The view was breathtaking and beyond expectations, and the staff kindly provided us with a blanket when we felt cold, which was a nice touch. The food was tasty, although the pasta was a bit too rich. We ordered pasta and a burger, and both were good. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. As a tourist spot, I will definitely return.

Very nice peak overlooking the Golden Horn. You could see nearly most of hidtoric Istanbul from out there. Restaurants offered medium quality food yet expensive. So be aware not to order much. The queue on the cable car was around 2 hours until you manage to go up and around 30 mins to go down. And during rush hours it go longer. So put that in your timing when you go visit the place.

Visited dreading a long queue for the Teleferik to get up here on a nice hot sunny weekday in early June. Imagine our surprise when there was nobody there. I'd imagine it would be a lot busier during the summer break! Cafe at the top is overpriced by virtue of its location. A nice place therefore just to make a modest order of drinks to soak up the view for a short while.

places.address: Merkez, İdris Köşkü Cd., 34050 Eyüpsultan/İstanbul, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: Located in Sultanahmet, Lokanta 1741 offers a unique dining experience with its Turkish cuisine served on a charming terrace featuring a cocktail bar. The restaurant provides an intimate and romantic atmosphere with subdued lighting and heating for cooler evenings. It's the perfect spot to enjoy contemporary twists on traditional Turkish dishes like Kakavaia fish stew.

sources.snippet: Lokanta 1741 is actually a 300-year-old  Cağaloğlu Turkish Bath. Juxtaposition of Ottoman tradition with again Ottoman cuisine is surely a one-of-a-kind experience. If you are looking for a place in which you can have a taste of the city’s historicity, culture, and local food in a romantic setting this place is the one for you.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Romantic Restaurants in Istanbul in 2024 – Turkey Things

sources.snippet: Roof Meze 360 Restaurant: if you are looking for a 360 degree panoramic view of the city and good food at an acceptable price, this is your place. It is one of the must-visits in Istanbul where, in addition to enjoying the views, the value for money is excellent.
sources.shortName: Istanbul for couples - enjoy the most romantic places

places.name: Lokanta 1741

reviews.text:
Honest review from a Tourist like us:
We found this restaurant during our Winter-Spring Holiday in Turkiye this year.

We had a ”mind-blowing” apéro-dinner at Lokanta 1741 – Our taste buds are still doing a happy dance! We ordered the Main course as for The Duck Dumpling and The Fish Stew . It was cooked to ”juicy perfection” and the desserts we had (I can't remember the name) like, it was Baklava Fusion, oh is  a Heavenly!! Don't even get me started on,
Also, you always can check the best wine pair food with the staff or their bartender as well.

We eat them every day if I could (as we are a big foodie traveler). Shoutout to the staff for being professional hospitable and attentive.  As I also someone who worked and had experience for 15 years in Hospitality Industry.

Wow, the food was awesome. They have both a set menu and a la Carte.  The food is out of the world. We had the set menu. 8 appetizers which you have to share with your partner ( not sure what happens if you go by yourself). One main course and a desert. It is quite filling. About $150 US dollars each.
The sore point that we had an obnoxious waiter who was very mean which made our entire experience bad. The manager was quite nice and tried to fix the issue, but I wouldn't go back because of that guy with the pony tail. He let the dish on the table and was busy with other guests and did not even give us cutlery.
Overall good food, enjoy you may not get the same guy.

Great experience, very friendly service from hotel entrance to service, and all very welcoming. They recommended a great crisp chardonnay. The sea bass was really great even if one end was slightly burned. All other plates were fantastic. The terrace and interior are also very quiet and cosy, away from the noise outside. Great spot!

places.address: Alemdar, Prof. Kazım İsmail Gürkan Cd. No:34, 34110 Fatih/İstanbul, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: The Golden Horn is a horn-shaped estuary in Istanbul, Turkey, serving as the primary inlet on the Bosporus. It is a bustling commercial hub with parks and has been home to sultans and their entourage for over four centuries. Overlooking the Bosphorus and the Sea of Marmara, Topkapi Palace offers stunning courtyards, gardens, and buildings where thousands used to reside. The palace's harem once housed hundreds of concubines and staff.

sources.snippet: The Golden Horn is a district of Istanbul surrounded by a horn-shaped fyord which is also called Golden Horn or Halic in the local language. The name comes from the golden reflection cast on the surface of the fyord during sunset. This beautiful district is surrounded with some of the must-see attractions of the city including the tomb of Abu Ayyub al-Ansari, ancient tombs of the Ottoman period, Santral Istanbul, and many more.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Romantic Places In Istanbul, Turkey

sources.snippet: Experience the most dramatic sunset with your partner at this romantic juncture of Golden Horn. It is a natural estuary connecting with the Bosphorus, where it meets with the Sea of Marmara, separating the Old Istanbul from the new one. The charm of the Golden Horn is the golden sunset lovers can experience from both coasts.
sources.shortName: 14 Best Romantic Places in Istanbul to Visit With Your Partner

sources.snippet: If you’re searching for romantic spots in Istanbul, don’t miss the Golden Horn. It’s where you can see an incredibly romantic sunset. As the sun goes down, everything turns into a scene from a fairy tale.
sources.shortName: 20 Most Romantic Places In Istanbul
The Most Famous Romantic Places in Istanbul

places.name: Golden Horn

reviews.text:
Crossing the Golden Horn at night was an unforgettable experience. The water shimmered under the city lights, with reflections of mosques, bridges, and the ever-busy Istanbul skyline creating a mesmerizing view. The contrast between the historical landmarks and the modern cityscape was striking, making it one of those moments that truly capture the essence of Istanbul.

Whether by ferry, car, or on foot across one of its bridges, the Golden Horn at night offers a unique perspective of the city. The illuminated mosques and streets on both sides make for a stunning sight, and the cool night breeze over the water adds to the atmosphere.

Definitely a must-experience moment when in Istanbul!

Golden Horn (Haliç) is an inlet of the Bosphorus with two rivers draining into it at the far end. It is considered to be the world's largest natural harbor and separates the European shore of Istanbul into two. The best places to observe the Golden Horn's activity and grace are the Galata Bridge if you want ringside seats, and the Topkapi Palace or Pierre Loti Café if you prefer a bird's-eye view.

As a natural and extremely secure harbor, the Golden Horn has played an important role in the development of Istanbul and was often the subject of attacks. With the absence of tides and currents, the Byzantine Empire had its naval headquarters in this 7,5 km long Bosphorus inlet
A breathtaking view from the bay. Mosque and Galata look standing tall and beautiful. A nice walking path with benches to sit and enjoy the evening.

places.generalDescription: Nardis Jazz Club, located near the iconic Galata Tower, is a cozy 120-seat venue with an intimate and down-to-earth vibe. The club hosts local jazz talents and collaborates with city jazz festivals to bring international artists to its small stage. The atmospheric club, run by local jazz enthusiasts, offers live performances on weekdays from 9:30 PM to 12:30 AM and on weekends from 10:30 PM to 1:30 AM.

sources.snippet: There’s nothing quite like a night in an intimate jazz bar to stir up a little romance—and Nardis is exactly what you’d conjure up in your mind when thinking of an ideal spot to get cozy and enjoy great local music. The compact jazz club has a rotating calendar of local and visiting jazz musicians. Note that the seating is first come, first served, so you’ll want to arrive in advance if you want a spot by the stage.
sources.shortName: 5 Romantic Date Spots In Istanbul To Visit This Spring

places.name: Nardis Jazz Club

reviews.text:
We had an unforgettable night at Nardis Jazz Club. The band was excellent, they played Jazz and Tango and I can't remember the last time I gained such pleasure from music. A huge thanks to the owners of the club for organising such a beautiful night!
About the place: the entrance fee is 800TL. The food is just your standard pub food, nothing fancy, but on a more expensive range of the spectrum. We heard loads of people complimenting cocktails, but we had beer. 290TL per draft Efes.
There is a show on each night, except for Sundays, you can look at their website to see the programme.
I highly recommend visiting this place, your soul will thank you!

Nardis Jazz Club is one of the most cozy venues on Istanbul's jazz scene, welcoming both local and international jazz musicians.
It is a real an intimate atmosphere for years. Located in the heart of Galata,  go and enjoy for an unforgettable nights with  warm ambiance.

Excellent and cozy place to chill and hang out away from the busy and noisy night of Istanbul.
Good price for the drinks compared to other bars and very polite staff. Would be back here for sure.🥂👍

places.address: Bereketzade, Galata Kulesi Sk. No:8, 34421 Beyoğlu/İstanbul, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: Heybeliada, the second-largest of the Princes' Islands near Istanbul, is a charming destination offering a mix of natural beauty and historical landmarks. The island is known for its lush pine groves, colorful redbuds, and well-preserved mansions. Visitors can explore the Greek Orthodox monastery atop a hill and enjoy the small harbor with its cafes. Heybeliada's beaches are perfect for swimming, while activities like rowing and sailing are popular as well.

sources.snippet: Heybeliada is Istanbul’s serene secret, ideal for couples looking for a romantic escape. Here, you’re greeted with historic churches, elegant wooden mansions, and lush paths. Cycling is a great way to see the island, and you can also enjoy a refreshing swim in the sea.
sources.shortName: 20 Most Romantic Places In Istanbul

places.name: Heybeliada

reviews.text: This was the only island i visited while i was in Turkey. It took about hour from Eminonu harbor to Heybeliada. Despite it was Saturday the island wasnt full of tourist so you could really enjoy explorig neighbourhoods and nature around island. If you want to completeley go around island it takes you 2 hours walking but its worth of it. I got some information from guards protecting some kind of object and from local people. The orthodox church ineae harbour is also beautiful with lot of decoration and religious icons. The only bad experience was that the churchkeeper because he was rude. He didnt allow me to see the liturgy held that day, even i was behind the doors. The other one was kind.

An adorable island with lots of shops and food options. The 30-45 min ferry to the island was pleasant and schedules are posted on the island for easy planning. There is a scenic walk around the island and picnic areas overlooking the water. The locals are very friendly.
This is the most beautiful island of the Prince islands. It's worth of visiting all time but it's better to go during the week days to avoid the crowds.

places.generalDescription: Mikla is a sophisticated fine dining restaurant located on the rooftop of the Marmara Pera Hotel in Istanbul. The restaurant boasts contemporary styling and offers a tasting menu with a blend of Turkish and Scandinavian influences. The elegant interior features mid-century modern design, while the teak-decked terrace provides stunning panoramic views of the city.

sources.snippet: Excuse me for starting rather bougie, but  Mikla Restaurant is the ultimate place for those of you looking for a good fine-dining option. “Forward-thinking but deeply rooted and above all delicious,” writes The New York Times. The restaurant is actually situated on the roof of The Marmara Pera Hotel, which is in Asmalımescit, Taksim.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Romantic Restaurants in Istanbul in 2024 – Turkey Things

sources.siteName: #1 Loved Istanbul Food Tours - Yummy Istanbul
sources.shortName: Honeymoon in Istanbul: 6 Most Romantic Things to Do & More

places.name: Mikla

reviews.text: I recently had the tasting menu at the restaurant and was thoroughly impressed. The Slow Cooked Beef Short Rib was particularly delectable, with its tender and melt-in-your-mouth texture. The Bolet Mushroom was also flavorful and creamy. The service was exceptional, and the city views were breathtaking. I highly recommend the tasting menu to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience.

The most special date night at Mikla!

We had an unforgettable evening at Mikla. hands down one of the most special date nights we've ever had. From the moment we arrived, everything was perfect: the breathtaking views, the elegant atmosphere, and the incredible food.

Each course was beautifully crafted, full of flavor, and presented with so much care. The ambiance set the perfect tone for a romantic night, and the service was attentive without being intrusive.

Mikla truly delivers a world-class dining experience. We'll cherish this evening for a long time highly recommended for a romantic night out or a celebration.

Had such an amazing dining experience at Mikla! Loved everything about this restaurant and can easily see why it's been listed on the The World's 50 Best Restaurant for a number of years and hasa  Michelin star! The setting: the top of The Marmara Pera (conveniently just went down a floor after a sneaky pre drinks at the rooftop bar). In the midst of jasmine scents accompanied by the refreshing breeze of Galata I take in breathtaking views shimmering in the setting sun where old mosques glow like gold crowns! It's impossible not to feel romanced by Istanbul!

The food here is innovatively delish! The menu combines contemporary techniques with traditional Anatolian recipes heroing fresh local produce from every corner of Anatolia to create beautiful dishes reflects the traditions of Anatolia's lands and people. I went with the 3 course a la carte menu and loved everything I ordered! My fave was the Seafood Casserole. The seafood was ocean fresh and the stew was a flavour bomb! 💣😋 Loved the spice kick it had too! The smoked duck was tasty too! Balanced really well with the sourness of the cherry in the salad and the pepper ham and white bean hummus! Desert was quite the sweet treat! Got the Burnt Hazelnut Halva loved the light creaminess of the rice pudding  and the refreshing kaffir lime hazelnut sorbet! Was super impressed by the 3 courses of complementary snacks too which really showcased creative modern flair to traditional flavours! 😍

places.address: The Marmara Pera, Asmalı Mescit, Meşrutiyet Cd. No:15, 34430 Beyoğlu/İstanbul, Türkiye

places.generalDescription: Agora Meyhanesi 1890 offers a genuine Turkish tavern experience, harking back to the pre-Republican Era. The restaurant, located in the old Jewish district of Balat and dating back to 1890, has been lovingly restored by a Turkish film producer. Chef Ahmet Ari prepares an array of 60 appetizers, including favorites like fried liver, almond-flavored zucchini, fish pastrami, and tarama.

sources.snippet: Greco-Turkish culture is famous for its tavern tradition which you should definitely experience. Generally, the best place for this experience is the south of Turkey along the Mediterranean coast. However, luckily for us all, Istanbul provides very authentic options as well.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Romantic Restaurants in Istanbul in 2024 – Turkey Things

places.name: Agora Meyhanesi 1890

reviews.text: This was an incredible authentic experience. The food was exceptional, the staff were warm and welcoming. House wine was excellent. Thank you for an incredible afternoon. 🇨🇦
We had choosen this place afte we visited the wonderful Balat itself. We had a great time as a girls group. The ambiance was very nice, the food was tasty, the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Visited twice during our weeklong trip. The grilled fish wrapped in vine leaf was divine. Ordered an array different mezes each time and they were all delicious. Thanks too to our server Mahmut who was friendly and attentive.

places.address: Balat, Mürselpaşa Cd. no:185, 34087 Fatih/İstanbul, Türkiye
